attributes.action: switch from the adversarial system in some (or all) criminal trials to the inquisitorial system
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In cases where the decision of the jury eventually comes down to 'who they choose to believe', reliant on pitting one person's word against another's, it happens that a jury can be 'persuaded' to believe an accuser in favour of the person accused, even when there is no factual evidence of a crime having been committed.  The 'innocent until proven guilty' is a good idea - but it is failing in these cases, where accusation alone can be considered to be 'proof enough'.
